Reviews.Title: “The best thing was the bed!”
Reviews.Author: Review_Investigator
Reviews.Content: pros: - next ti the marina where all the yachts are - there is a near by food center and many other seafood rest.'s - after using the hotel room cards, it gives you a feeling of going back to the 1980's haha! cons: - Old interior design, old furniture , rough towels to a point your skin might bleed. - NO wifi, so you cant do any business or any nothing your all alone without net. - business center is dangerous to use, slow PC your passwords can get into risk - breakfast was so basic - very depressive hotel recommend: to find something a little bit better to stay in, this is a remote hotel with nothing to do, its really boring and not worth the experience. Life is too short to stay in a bad hotel. was my review helpful?

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bizwiz1
Reviews.Content: Good position being close to the airport (20 mins by minibus) , free airport transfers from 7.00am in the morning. Reasonable choice in the Restaurant, rooms were large size with clean bed linen and towels. The Hotel is looking a little dated with respect to furnishings and bath ware, I did find that the suites included in the rooms were heavily stained and dirty. A seemingly lack of plug points were also a problem. I was asked twice for ID in the restaurant at breakfast?? Wheelchair access was a definite no for all rooms as a flight of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need internet this hotel is great !”
Reviews.Author: go2mike
Reviews.Content: I really don't mind paying for internet but if I stay in a hotel and have to pay for bad internet this sends me over the edge. When I complained the reception said "yes it bad ! sometimes it works but most of the time it does not !" So I checked out and found a great hotel where communication is what it should be. The hotel itself is in a great location, close to Ataturk International Airport and on the Marina. Its an old hotel but big rooms and as I was in an unusual cold snow storm all the rooms were very warm. Staff were friendly and breakfast good and as the hotel was busy with airline crew and tourists I guess they do not need to attract the business traveler. But as I depend on internet and Skype for work , could not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: SuddenlySusan65
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Atakoy Marina September 2011. The rooms were not clean, there was no room service even though there is suppose to be. They had coffee making facilities but no coffee, sugar etc even after we requested it several times. It took 3 days for them to provide coffee etc. We booked two rooms, my kids were with out sheets, pillows and blankets for 2 nights. No discount to us for having a room with no bed made up. They are suppose to change the sheets every three days - not changed once the whole time we were there (6 days). BEWARE of the cleaners, they close the door when they are in your room and rummage through your suitcases, unfortunately for my daughter, who hid her ring inside her suitcase that was closed, was STOLEN. We have travelled everywhere and never once has anything being stolen. This left us with such a bitter taste in our mouths and ruined our experience in Istanbul. When we asked for the police to be notified they said they would sort it out - they didn't so we lodged a report with the police and checked out a day earlier. They charge 4 star prices but provide a 0 star service. Never, ever would we recommend the Atakoy Marina!!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare by the marine”
Reviews.Author: yashoSpain
Reviews.Content: the food is plastic, the endless corridors exhausting, several gadgets in the room didn't work from kettle to tv remote control. it's noisy and stuffy, it's ugly, it's expensive, no water pressure in the shower, need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “A bad hotel and even worse value”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night in August 2011, before catching an early morning flight from the IST airport. I will never stay here again, you can be sure of that. First, it is only ten or fifteen minutes from the Istanbul Airport, but on such an out-of-the-way croner of the airport area that the taxi driver couldn't find it. I kept telling him it was near the Sheraton (I googled the location and it is adjacent to that 40-story landmark on the same street!) but he was sure it was someplace else. This is the kind of stress a frequent traveller just doesn't need -- arguing with a Turkish taxi driver in the middle of the night in a language you don't understand. Take me to the Marriott, I should have said. The lobby is small, dark and dingy. The staff was disinterested and untrained. It fook four of them to check me in and -- amazingly -- could not get my platinum AMEX card to be approved. It needed a PIN, they said, which of course an AMEX never does. So I had to put it on a different card, which really annoyed the heck out of me. The price was about US$150, which I tolerated because it's supposed to be next to the airport and airport hotels are always pricey. But this was a terrible value. After the desulatory check-in process, the bellhop grabbed my bags and took me DOWN a small flight of stairs to the world's smallest elevator to go UP to our room. It was so small my wife refused to get in it, and walked up the stairs to the room. We chugged up in the lift and she still managed to beat us there. The hallways are dark and dreary. The room was large enough, but heavily worn. The TV was old and had very few channels (it did have CNN and BBC). There was a tiny balcony for our ocean view, but we couldn't see any ocean, not with radar or even the Hubble Telescope. Most annoyingly, we could not get the shower to work, so we had to splash some water on ourselves and call it clean. (While we're on the subject... bad plumbing really lights my rocket. I have three college degrees and am a commercial pilot. You think i'd be able to figure out how to use a shower, right? So that device (see photo) either was broken or so frozen by years of hard water that it didn't work. Or I'm an idiot -- which is always a possibility, I will agree -- but it shouldn't take an engineering degree to get hot water!) Anyhow, we had a drink in the empty Anchor Bar at the hotel, served by a very nice young man who was desperate for a customer (or even some company). We looked into the hotel restaurant and retreated instantly -- ptomaine poisoning lurked on the menu I am sure. We finally found dinner by walking behind the hotel to the marina and there was a very nice fish restaurant there. Perfect. The only good thing that happened at this hotel, and it happend away from it. So save your pennies and go to the Sheraton. Even your taxi driver will thank you for it.

Reviews.Title: “Overprice”
Reviews.Author: Paldrevl
Reviews.Content: Old rooms, no air condition. Breakfast and staff mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible expensive 4 Star Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laila1209
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at Atakoy Marina Hotel, I read some review that this hotel was very poor but still we booked 1 night as we are attending a wedding reception at the Marina. I find that for 98 Euro was too expensive for the hotels condition. Reception people was not so friendly and accomodating, they didnt even welcome us or not even a smile from them. As we entered, the room was quite spacious and has big balcony too but the room furnishing was a bit outdated, the toilet cover was broken so as the shower head. We didnt bother asking for a room change as we were only staying for a night. This hotel need some big renovation and refurbishing. Dont really know who gives Star ratings to hotels, based on what we saw and experience....this hotel dont deserves 4 star rating at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very old 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Simpson1975
Reviews.Content: Resided in the hotel 2 nights in mid January. Reality does not match the description on the website of the hotel. Perhaps, once this was really the hotel category 4 stars, but since that much time has passed. Bathroom is small and looks very old. Fixing shower fixes bad, setting water temperature is like to impossible - hot replaces cold and vice versa. Toilet noise for about 20 minutes after washout. There is nothing more than liquid soap and a terrible shower gel (both in containers attached to the wall). All additional cosmetics have to ask at the reception - but in this case they havent shampoo or shower gel, only cotton buds and shawing set. In my room was not working teapot (was not plugged into an outlet - directly into the electricity network). Mechanism for closing the blinds was broken, on the floor was pieces of hardware. Balcony door closes poorly. Large-size bed, pillows enough. In general, the room is large and could be useful. Wi Fi works poorly - is often lost the signal, or the connection becomes slow. Internet access for a day costs 10 liras (5 euros). However, the business center and internet speed is even worse. Restaurant and room service pretty decent. Everything is delicious, the restaurant is large and clean, service is quick and attentive. Breakfast is quite varied and tasty. The hotel's location is convenient in terms of distance from the airport. Transfer to the airport by 5 to 9 am, and after 14 pm. There is a shuttle service to the city center (2 times a day). Was not completely bad or good, nothing outstanding. Istanbul have many better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worst than ever”
Reviews.Author: trip4life1979
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that I had to wait more than 1.5 hour at lobby for waiting room cleaning. Not only me but also I could see a lot of people had to wait as well. The receptionist's attitude could not make me feel like being at a hothel rather than at the workhouse. They yell at me when I was asking for their help to check the Internet connection. Unbelievable !!!!! The internet is free but just for one hour only. Then if you need to keep using Internet, expensive charge must be born. The place seemed to be located in the isolated area where you could not see anything. Really my nightmare to stay in where I ever seen 1st time in my life. it really ruined my trip to turkey. So, please do not step on my stupid foot print of spending your love time at this suck hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time travel to the 70s”
Reviews.Author: AgentAC
Reviews.Content: located near the airport, by the sea with nice view. Stayed one night but would have preferred to have stayed somewhere else. Very old and tired decoration. Not dirty but could not say it was clean. Breakfast was nice and big variety. Wifi internet was very expensive. There is a mall a few meters away which i did not visit since i was on a business trip. Rates were ok but still the hotel could have been a bit better, do not recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: prepuc
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very good from the photos, but once there you get disappointed. We were there to watch the World Championship in Basketball, and the hotel served its purpose. We got a room, it was clean but very worn down. The hotel was not even near 4 star status. The hotel is very off side. It suited us well because it was close to the arena where the games were played, but to come to Istanbul you have to take a cab (approx 20 min ride - approx 13 â‚¬). There were no other connections. The breakfast at the hotel was very good (definitely 4 star status) The shuttle from the hotel to the airport did not work as promised. I thing there are two tours a day. I checked beforehand and was promised a tour that never arrived. The pool is 15 minutes away, and it was closed when we were there. You are not allowed to swim in the see, and there are no real beaches nearby (you get the impression from the photos)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but old”
Reviews.Author: keris73
Reviews.Content: All i needed was a room with a good bed, clean bathroom, working airco. this hotel had those so for me it was fine, rooms are outdated and the place needs a face lift. Staff spoke English, at least some did. Breakfast ok, help from staff, don't expect too much. Internet didn't work and is not free, even overpriced. For a sleep ok, for a holiday i wouldn't go here

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible! Don't even think of going there...!!”
Reviews.Author: jojomizo2
Reviews.Content: It was terrible!!! We didn't enjoy any moment in it! The staff were very rude, suspicious, and not helpful. The room and bathroom were very old and not clean. The whole hotel suffered from lack of maintenance and was in urgent need for renovation and upgrade! The swimming pool had no lifeguard, no children's pool for children. The swimming pool was located so far from the hotel building; it took 30 minutes to walk there and another 30 minutes to walk back!! When we received our room, the safe had been left locked by the earlier guest, and no one had bothered checking it to unlock it. The Air conditioning was not functioning, the television had no signal, the room was not clean, carpet old, grungy and smelly, it was all horrible. We reported the first 3 problems, then went out for 4 hours, came back, and the staff hadn't even bothered to go check and repair!!! What a non-caring low quality attitude!!! For that alone, not counting the other problems, this hotel does not even deserve a one star rating!!! There' was nothing we liked about this hotel. Be careful! Donâ€™t go there!

Reviews.Title: “Located on sea front , old in style”
Reviews.Author: Storyteller18
Reviews.Content: It is a old hotel which have been renamed .the rooms are big and comfortable though the bathroom fittings are old .breakfast is reasonable and service is also fast.however i cd not understand why the lift is not available for first floor as that creates a lot of problems for people with heavy baggage .it is centrally located with some of the shopping centres nearby .A ferry station is within walking distance .A good bargain .

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel, fraying at the edges”
Reviews.Author: virginvoyager
Reviews.Content: This is a tired hotel, fraying at the edges with surly, charmless staff. I booked and pre-paid a three night stay with a reputable company. First there was an argument with the Hotel because, despite their paperwork, they insisted I had booked only two nights. Then they decided I must be attending a Conference which was being held at a hotel nearby and that I should pay the Conference delegate rate which was Euros 60 a night more. Guilty until I could prove myself innocent. Avoid this property if you can. Sleep in the airport Departure Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the website!”
Reviews.Author: DubWoman
Reviews.Content: We booked our room directly from the website as we were taken in by the 'garden view' or 'marina view' descriptions. However they forgot to mention the view of a car park and sports complex directly between the hotel and the marina! They also advertise a shuttle bus complete with timetable. DO NOT rely on the timetable. We were stranded twice as the buses did not turn up for us, and the shuttle to the airport was full but they didn't offer any alternative. The staff were not helpful at all. The swimming pool is a ten minute walk away and there is very little to do at the hotel if the weather is dull. The rooms were quite big and comfortable but a little bit dated. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never go there ..................”
Reviews.Author: Mona771
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for 5 days and i wouldnt advise anyone to stay there not even for a mintue for a number of reasons; The staff were not helpful nor unfriendly..No internet acess very far from the sites the rooms were not clean and had a very bad smell the ac do not work bathrooms were not clean and no shampoo or soap the resturant was expensive and the food was not near to eatible The breakfast room was always crowded and not enough food for everyone in short i do not recommand this hotel to anyone not friend nor enmey.........

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but beware the extras”
Reviews.Author: Harpenden_Mike
Reviews.Content: Searching the internet for an overnight stay in Istanbul I found a very good rate offered at this hotel. The rooms were comfortable, and generally well equipped, pretty much what one would expect from a Holiday Inn. There were a few niggles: The electronic lock on our room was faulty, resulting in two or three trips to reception followed by a twenty minute wait for a technician to open the door. The breakfast was adequate but did not justify the price of EUR25 per person. In general there were a number of charges for servcies which other similar hotels provide free. There was a fairly noisy wedding feast taking place around the pool which could be heard in the room, but this seemed to stop around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel- its information misleading”
Reviews.Author: dave54t
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice. The room was spacious, and as each Holiday Inn, it is very clean, with daily cleaning and change service. It locates in a quite area. Problems: 1. Unlike the information provided in the hotel site, it is not close to sites like the blue mosque or the Topkapy palace. Actually, it is quite far from them. However, a tram runs directly from near the hotel to all the major sites- the tram is almost always overcrowded. 2. While the hotel rates are reasonable, they charge for everything they can, and relatively the charge is high: unlike US Holiday Inn, they won't provide free internet connection- it costs 10 Euro for 24 hours. The restaurant is terribly expensive- the breakfast buffet, costs in a typical US HI resraurant between $12 to $15 will cost you here at least $25. All in all, the hotel is fine, a typical Holiday Inn hotel (which is good news!); out of the city center-which is not a bad thing, with good but very busy public trasportation. The only problem- the greediness of the hotel operators.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant is lousy and expensive”
Reviews.Author: jdavis11007
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at this hotel, but at the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi across the street, which is definitely nicer. But we did eat at its Pizza restaurant and the experience was horrible. Bad and expensive food. We should have eaten at our own hotel but wanted to venture out and didn't want to take the tram for the 15-20 minute ride back into the center. What a mistake. Don't eat here, at least not for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “a reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: nightcrowler
Reviews.Content: This a hotel with very reasonable prices located in a neighbourhood close to the airport. The hotel offers shuttle service to downtown for free. Guests of the hotel can use the swimming pool of Crown Plaza Hotel which is only a few minutes walking distance away. Breakfast is very good and the stuff is polite and eager to help. The hotel is not in downtown or in old city and that is the only disadvantage; however the shuttle service is a solution to that. RecommendedÃ§

Reviews.Title: “polite but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has air conditioned hallways, but they did not turn on the airconditioning in the rooms. So we had two choices, either close the windows to prevent the noise from the streets and then the temperature in the room increased to 27 degrees C , or to keep the windows open. and then even though we were on the fourth floor and faced away from the road on the garden side there was lots of noice late at night, and were woken up in the early morning from dogs barking. My complaints did not help. otherwise the hotel is clean and the breakfast that was included was good. It is close to the train, so it is convinent to get to town. It probably would be better to get a hotel in the areas off the main road by the old city. I got a fax after my complaint which shows they didn't understand the complaint. The sauna was open only to 18:00 for some strange reason.

HotelInfo.Name: Atakoy Marina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sahilyolu | AtakÃ¶y, Istanbul 34158 , Turkey (Formerly Holiday Inn)
